SECRET.
G.T.5859
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 2nd OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the ST. QUENTIN-CAMBRAI Front the line runs ST. QUENTIN (Inclusive) along the canal to LESDINS, and then to SEQUEHART, PRESELLES, ESTREES, BONY, VENDHUILLE (all inclusive) along the canal to CREVECOEUR (inclusive) RUMILLY (inclusive) FBG. de PARIS, NEUVILLE-ST-REMY, TILLON (inclusive) BLECOURT (doubtful) along the railway to AUBENCHEUL-le-BAC.
On the YPRES Front we do not hold ROLLEGHEMCAPPELE. Belgians report capture of VIERSCHEAR and KRUIS STRAAT (S.E. of ZARREN).
We have taken FLEURBAIX (S.W. of ARMENTIERES).
French Front.
Between the AISNE and the VESLE the French have made good progress. The line runs NEUVILLETTE, ST. THIERRY, POUILLON, CHATEAU HERVELON - BOUVANCOURT, GUYENCOURT ROUCY, CONCEVREUX, MAIZY.
On the ARGONNE Front, the Americans have retaken CIERGES and have got across GESNES-EXERMONT Road, but do not hold either of these villages. The French have taken LANCON. From there line runs South-west to north edge of BOIS MOYON - north-west to CHATEAU FRANCS FOSSES - north of VAUX. Westwards there is no change.
2. MACEDONIAN AND ITALIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
3. PALESTINE FRONT.
We have taken Damascus.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
2nd October, 1918.
